column1: #Text=—At the City Grounds, near the Ashton-road, there was a rabbit match decided yesterday between H.
#Text=Smiths Tiny, running at oatch weight, both, of Liverpool, tor £20.
#Text=The conditions were the best of 21 oourses, 60 yards law.
#Text=The betting was 6t04 on Sweep, who proved an easy winner by catching 11 to Tinys 2.
#Text=—At the Royal Oak park Grounds, Newton Heath, yesterday, there were a couple of rabbit matches decided, the moat important being between J.
#Text=Joness Boss, 31 ooursee itLe former having one course given), for J£m), both dogs bailing from Crewe.
#Text=The betting was 6t04 on Boss, but fhe was defeated by 6 courses, Rose catching 15, with tLe course given, while Bess was only 10.
#Text=—The concluding heats of a monster Christmas handicap, distance2o7 yards, which commenced on Saturday at the Hyde Park Grounds, Sb* ffield, were run off yesterday for prizes amounting to £100.
#Text=The prize was £80, second £12 10a, third £5, and fourth £2 IBs.
#Text=The following 15 winners on Saturday were drawn in four heats:—E.
#Text=The final heat resulted in favour of Dunster by two yards; Ward was second, a yard in advance of Crawshaw; and Wingfield fourth.
#Text=The betting at the start was even on Dunster, 6 to 4 agst Ward, 7 to 1 agst Crawshaw, and 14 to 1 agst WingSeid.
#Text=There wss a heavy fall of snow during the tiase of running, but despite the weather upwards of 6,000 persons were present.
